name: Anne-Sophie
bio: Anne-Sophie is a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America and has worked in top restaurants around the world. Their cuisine is inspired by traditional French techniques and local ingredients.

recipes.name: Beef Wellington
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Sear the beef fillet on all sides
2. Spread mushroom duxelles on puff pastry and wrap the beef in it
3. Bake in the oven until golden brown

recipes.name: Lobster Bisque
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Saute onion, carrot, and celery in butter
2. Add lobster shells and brandy and simmer
3. Strain and add cream and chopped lobster meat

recipes.name: Chocolate Souffle
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler
2. Beat egg whites and sugar until stiff peaks form
3. Fold in flour, egg yolks, and chocolate mixture
4. Bake in ramekins until risen

name: Thomas Keller
bio: Thomas Keller is a self-taught chef who loves to experiment with new flavors and techniques. Their cuisine is influenced by Asian and Latin American cuisines.

recipes.name: Roasted Cauliflower Steak
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Slice cauliflower into thick steaks and season with olive oil, smoked paprika, and garlic
2. Roast in the oven until tender and browned
3. Serve with a squeeze of lemon and chopped parsley

recipes.name: Roasted Cauliflower Steak
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Slice cauliflower into thick steaks and season with olive oil, smoked paprika, and garlic
2. Roast in the oven until tender and browned
3. Serve with a squeeze of lemon and chopped parsley

recipes.name: Korean Fried Chicken
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Mix flour and cornstarch
2. Beat egg with gochujang, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger
3. Coat chicken wings in flour mixture and fry until crispy
4. Toss wings in gochujang sauce

name: Mario Batali
bio: Mario Batali has a passion for creating innovative dishes that blend different cultural influences. They have worked in several Michelin-starred restaurants and love to experiment with molecular gastronomy.

recipes.name: Scallop Ceviche
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Slice scallops thinly and marinate in lime juice
2. Add diced red onion and chopped cilantro
3. Serve with sliced avocado and tortilla chips

recipes.name: Sous Vide Steak
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Season steak with salt, pepper, rosemary, and garlic
2. Seal in vacuum bag and cook in sous vide water bath
3. Finish by searing in a hot pan

recipes.name: Matcha Tiramisu
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Beat egg yolks with sugar until thick and pale
2. Fold in mascarpone cheese and whipped cream
3. Dip ladyfingers in matcha tea and layer with the mascarpone mixture
4. Chill and dust with matcha powder before serving

name: Eric Ripert
bio: Eric Ripert is a master of French cuisine, with experience working in some of the world's top fine dining restaurants. They are known for their elegant and refined dishes, and their attention to detail is unmatched.

recipes.name: Beef Wellington
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Sear beef tenderloin and set aside
2. Saute mushrooms with shallots and garlic
3. Spread prosciutto and mushroom mixture over puff pastry
4. Wrap beef tenderloin in puff pastry and brush with egg wash
5. Bake in oven until golden brown and cooked to desired temperature

recipes.name: Lobster Bisque
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Saute shallots, celery, and carrots in butter
2. Add tomato paste and cook until caramelized
3. Add lobster and cover with water
4. Simmer until lobster is cooked
5. Remove lobster and puree soup with heavy cream
6. Serve with chopped lobster meat

recipes.name: Creme Brulee
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat cream and sugar until just boiling
2. Beat egg yolks with vanilla extract
3. Slowly pour hot cream into egg mixture, whisking constantly
4. Pour mixture into ramekins and bake in a water bath
5. Chill and sprinkle with sugar before torching to create a caramelized crust

name: William Bradley
bio: William Bradley is a versatile chef who has worked in kitchens all over the world. They are skilled in a variety of cuisines and are always experimenting with new flavor combinations.

recipes.name: Spicy Shrimp Stir Fry
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a wok
2. Add garlic and ginger and sauté for 30 seconds
3. Add shrimp and cook until pink
4. Add sliced bell peppers and onion
5. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili flakes
6. Stir-fry for another minute and serve over rice

recipes.name: Roasted Vegetable Salad
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat oven to 425°F
2. Toss butternut squash, Brussels sprouts, and red onion with olive oil, salt, and pepper
3. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes
4. Toss roasted vegetables with pecans, maple syrup, Dijon mustard, and apple cider vinegar
5. Serve warm or at room temperature

recipes.name: Thai Red Curry Chicken
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a pot or wok
2. Add red curry paste and sauté for a minute
3. Add chicken and cook until browned
4. Add sliced carrots and bell peppers
5. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil
6. Reduce heat and add bamboo shoots, fish sauce, and brown sugar
7. Simmer until chicken is cooked and sauce has thickened
8. Serve with rice

name: Aliya LeeKong
bio: Aliya LeeKong has been cooking for over 20 years and has trained in some of the best kitchens in the world. They specialize in French cuisine but also love to experiment with fusion dishes.

recipes.name: Ratatouille
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F
2. Slice eggplant, zucchini, and yellow squash into 1/4-inch rounds
3. Slice tomatoes and red onion into thin rounds
4. Arrange vegetables in a casserole dish in alternating layers
5. Sprinkle garlic and herbs de Provence over the vegetables
6. Drizzle with olive oil
7. Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes
8. Remove foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes until vegetables are tender and slightly browned

recipes.name: Korean Fried Chicken
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F
2. Mix flour, cornstarch, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl
3. Coat chicken wings in the flour mixture
4. Place wings on a wire rack on top of a baking sheet
5. Bake for 40-45 minutes until crispy and golden brown
6. Mix gochujang, honey, soy sauce, and rice vinegar in a small saucepan
7. Heat over low heat until the sauce thickens
8. Toss the baked wings in the sauce and serve immediately

recipes.name: Mango Lassi
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Peel and chop mango into small pieces
2. Add mango, yogurt, milk, honey, and cardamom to a blender
3. Blend until smooth and creamy
4. Pour into glasses and serve chilled
